scenes.scene_number_extraction_reason: The scene is labeled as scene 1 in the script provided.
scenes.start_line_number_extraction_reason: The scene starts at line 16 as indicated by the scene heading 'EXT. PARK - DAY'.
scenes.synopsis: Tom and Summer sit silently on a park bench, their hands touching, as Tom gazes at Summer with admiration.

intimacy: Tom looks at her the way every woman wants to be looked at.

scenes.sceneText:
1 EXT. PARK - DAY                                              1

 For a few seconds we watch A MAN (20s) and a WOMAN (20s) on a
 park bench. Their names are TOM and SUMMER. Neither one says
 a word.

 CLOSE ON her HAND, covering his. Notice the wedding ring. No
 words are spoken. Tom looks at her the way every woman wants
 to be looked at.

 A DISTINGUISHED VOICE begins to speak to us.

                   NARRATOR
 This is a story of boy meets girl.

                                               CUT TO:

scenes.scene_number_extraction_reason: The scene number is explicitly stated as 2 in the script, and the scene offset is 3, which aligns with the numbering.
scenes.start_line_number_extraction_reason: The scene starts at line 33 as indicated by the scene header 'INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - DAY'.
scenes.synopsis: Tom Hansen sits bored in a conference room, reflecting on his belief in soulmates.
scenes.sceneText:
2 INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - DAY                                   2

 The boy is TOM HANSEN. He sits at a very long rectangular
 conference table. The walls are lined with framed blow-up
 sized greeting cards. Tom, dark hair and blue eyes, wears a
 t-shirt under his sports coat and Adidas tennis shoes to
 balance out the corporate dress code. He looks pretty bored.

                   NARRATOR
 The boy, Tom Hansen of Margate, New
 Jersey, grew up believing that he’d
 never truly be happy until the day
 he met his-- “soulmate.”

                                               CUT TO:

scenes.scene_number_extraction_reason: The scene number is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the scene as '3 INT. LIVING ROOM - 1989'.
scenes.start_line_number_extraction_reason: The scene starts at line 49 as indicated by the scene number and description '3 INT. LIVING ROOM - 1989'.
scenes.synopsis: Pre-teen Tom watches 'The Graduate,' misinterpreting its message, influenced by sad British pop music.
scenes.sceneText:
3 INT. LIVING ROOM - 1989                                      3

 PRE-TEEN TOM sits alone on his bed engrossed in a movie. His
 walls are covered in posters of obscure bands. From the TV,
 we hear: “Elaine! Elaine!”

                   NARRATOR
 This belief stemmed from early
 exposure to sad British pop music
 and a total misreading of the
 movie, “The Graduate.”
 [PAGE BREAK]
                                                                2.
                                                       CUT TO:
